body: The latter is doing pretty much the same thing but in a confusing way (it doesn't change the type of the variable, but does change the semantics). --- This change is [](https://reviewable.io/reviews/toktok/c-toxcore/1297)

comment_data.body: Maybe a stupid question. Why don't we use a `sizeof(struct...)`? Why these `VALUE_MEMBER` and `ARRAY_MEMBER` macros?

Because there are different operations in different functions that I want to have exactly the same syntax. Consider this list of calls the "reflection metadata" for the struct, and the macro definitions the actual code that uses the metadata to do whatever it needs to do.

Yes, I considered the optimisation, and I decided against it. Serialisation is by far not the part of toxcore that takes the most time, so it would be added complexity for negligible gain.
I thought about this more as cleanup and toxcore needs a lot of cleanup.

commit.message:
Use net_pack/unpack instead of host_to_net.

The latter is doing pretty much the same thing but in a confusing way (it
doesn't change the type of the variable, but does change the semantics).
